metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19947 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: In the Linux kernel through 5.4.6, there are information leaks of uninitialized memory to a USB device in the drivers/net/can/usb/kvaser_usb/kvaser_usb_leaf.c driver, aka CID-da2311a6385c. It was discovered that the Kvaser CAN/USB driver in the Linux kernel did not properly initialize memory in certain situations. A local attacker could possibly use this to expose sensitive information (kernel memory).

notes.Note: tyhicks> I don't think that the Fixes tag in patch is correct and that the info leaks were possible since the initial inclusion of the driver

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
